column4: Hi all, i really need a push in the right direction. I need to share users and groups across my lan so that all the computers on the lan can access my NFS shares and manipulate files with their respective permissions. What software would i use to accomplish this?
are you in a workplace or at home? Do you have windows machines currently connected to your network?
Its a home network although i am not really concerned about serving the windows machines. Nonetheless i wouldnt mind if your solution would help both

if you have to service samba clients, it'd probably be easiest to just set up the share as a cifs or smb share, and set the permissions of the share to a user of a specific machine on your network. Such as if you have a windows client named 'clientA', you could add some users to 'clientA' that the rest of your users on your home network would use to access the share with
then on the new smb share, add the permissions of the new users you created in the fashion on "clientA\user1"
ill try and explain exactly what i am tryin to do and why i am using nfs.
